I need advice again... I feel like my friends are leaving me out. Maybe Im being a baby about it but it really hurts my feelings. I told the I felt like a loner, what else do yall think I should do?

I can certainly understand what you're going through. A similar situation happened to me at the end of my freshman year. And you know what? It was probably the best thing that happened to me. I found a new group of friends and they invited me to join new organizations (one of them being the debate team!). And to top it all off, when I started hanging out with the new group, a lot of the people from the old group started inviting me back.

i never cared too much for the group thing. luckily, i had a group of long-time friends, and we stuck together. we were a group of intellects that accepted anyone and everyone. my point is, accept everyone and you will blur the line between the group system. i see myself as clear; i blend in with everyone.

and if they treat you this way in the first place, why would you want to converse or associate with them in any way? become outgoing. you will meet many people that way and will find out you don't need your old clique anyway.

and if they treat you this way in the first place, why would you want to converse or associate with them in any way? become outgoing. you will meet many people that way and will find out you don't need your old clique anyway.
 
 
 Exactly Gilligan, that's why I found a new group when I experienced that. Not only did the other group lose me, but I think they were somewhat jealous when they found that I was having just as much fun as I would have otherwise, but they weren't. And I think my new group certainly kept me from being expelled, but that's probably not an issue here.

So what do u do when ur best friend seems to be ignoring u and is getting into a lot of stupid XXXX??

You try to talk to her, if that doesnt work, aproach her w/ a few other close friends. If they dont change or try to change, all you can really do is pray. Now, if she is getting into BAD stuff try to talk to a grow up who is close to her and that might have a good influense on her/his life.
